instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message:
very small water damage near UB300:
corrosion on:  CB300 - PP3V3_G3H_RTC and CB308 - PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO 
replace both, all the voltage ok around UB300.
charger with battery: 20v and pulsing Amp 0A - 0.8A
charger without battery: 20V 0.04A stable.

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message: Did you try DFU mode?

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message:
i was came this morning I assembled the board, suddenly i sew the empty battery icon on the screen i was connected the charger but the same(dead)
i put it in DFU mode tried Revive and Restore and get the error:
GAVE UP WAITING FOR DEVICE TO TRANSITION FROM DFU STATE TO DFU STATE (4005)
there is Trackpad activity when it try install.
tried also PRAM but nothing...

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message:
Do not confuse trackpad click with activity.

Did you try DFU with charger and battery, both connected?
With charger alone, do you get all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages?

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message: PP3V3_AWAKE pulsing 0v-3.3v

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message: all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages pulsing every 10-14sec

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message: Shouldn't pulse if battery is connected; you've said to get battery icon image.

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message:
i measure with just board and charger.
i get the battery icon just one time..i dont get it anymore..

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message: So test if you get stable voltage with battery and charger connected.

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message: yes the same....pulsing also with charger and battery connected.

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message:
What about F7000 and L6900 voltage?
Test with charger alone and charger + battery.

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message:
L6900 - charger alone and charger + battery 3.4V stable!
F7000 - charger alone: 12.6v-12.3v pulsing
               charger+battery: 12.8v -10v pulsing(stay at 10v for few sec and then up to 12.8v and then down to 10v and repeat.

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message:
There must be something else affected by liquid.
Inspect and reflow U7800 area.

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message:
i was reflow U7800 no change.. small water damage was just on  CB300 - PP3V3_G3H_RTC and CB308 - PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO. all the rest are very clear..
can it be  UB300?

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message:
All USB ports have the same behavior?
An issue located on USB-C, shouldn't stop the board to work with battery.

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message: yes all of them doing the same...what else can be?

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message: all the port pulsing Amp from 0.070a to 0a just board and charger

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message:
I can only think to something elese affected by corrosion.
Not easy to find where...

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message:
succeed to enter DFU mode
one of the dots on the area i didnt notice that after the clean it was unconnected(PP1V8_MESA_FILT_CONN) its goes to the power button and because that it doesn't enter in DFU mode.
but dont pass the reviving.
also notice that AUD_CONN_RING2/SLEEVE full short.. should be like that?

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message: suddenly it was turn on work for 2-3min then again shout off and back to 20v 0.04a...can i replace U7800?

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message: You can try reballing it first.

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message: i was reballing and also replace from donor board but it still act the same(20v 0.04a pulsing)

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message:
update: 
the mac sometimes work for few min then shout off.. the charging Amp still pulsing..

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message: Do you have known good battery?

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message: yes i was try with new battery, i will try u7800 again..

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message:
update: 
i was get and put new U7800, the mac was turn on working for 10-15min then screen was freeze and shot off and not turn on again!
charger without battery 20V A-pulsing from 0 to 0.05A
charger with battery 20V A-pulsing from 0 to 0.7A
all ports the same

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message:
Did you reflow U7800?
Try new chip also.

You've said doesn't turn on, but no idea which voltages appear now on the board...

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message:
PPBUS_G3H 12.3v
PP3V3_S5 0V
PP1V8_S3 0V
PP3V3_G3H 3.3v
PP5V_S4_T_USBC 0V

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message:
Is the machine recognized in DFU?
If not, check if all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages are present.

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message:
yes is enter to DFU.
all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages pulsing

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message: Did you change U7800 again?

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message: yes

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message:
can be dead again?
i was put a new one and then it was turn on after few min it was shout off and dead again.
i was replace another new one but didn't turn on again..

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message:
That is really strange.
Be sure to get good solders.
Did you reflow any U7800 before changed it?

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message: yes.. also reball

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message: Did it try to start after reball?

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message:
i was reball/replace U7800 again, now is stuck on 5V and 0.2A 
its recognized as DFU.

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message: Can you complete DFU now?

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message:
no its not complete...
now with battery 20v 0a
without battery 5v 0.2a

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message:
PPBUS_G3H and all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages stable?
Also check SSD voltages.

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message:
PPBUS_G3H 12.2V stable
AWAKE and SLPS2R are pulsing with the AMP pulse..
PP1V8_SSD0 0V
PP2V7_NAND_SSD0 0V
PP0V9_SSD0 0V
PP3V3_G3H_SSD0 3.3V

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message: Check diode mode to ground at SSD rails with 0V.

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message: good reading on diode mode, 300-400

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message: Check output voltages for U7800 (SYM 1 OF 4), page 75.

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message:
LDO_CORE 1.5V
PP0V8_SLPS2R  0.8V pulsing.
PP3V_G3H_RTC 3V
PP1V2_AWAKE 1.2v pulsing
PMU_LDO3_OUT 1.8v
CPU_C10_GATE_L [B]0V[/B]
PP1V_S0SW [B]0V[/B]
LDO_RTC [B]0V[/B]
PMU_VPUMP 5V
PP3V3_AWAKE 3.3V pulsing
PP3V3_S5 [B]0V[/B]

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground at LDO_RTC.
R7900 is really 0 ohm?

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message: R7900 was short, replace and now LDO_RTC 1.3V

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message:
Maybe was broken/open; short (0 ohm) is its correct value!

Board still not turning on?
Check the other voltages, missing/pulsing before.

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message:
I didn’t mentioned (0 ohm) :rolleyes:
Board still the same 5v 0.2 to 0A pulsing

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message:
"R7900 was short"
Doesn't this mean 0 ohm between its pins?
How much did you expect to get for 0 ohm resistor?
By definition, a short means 0 ohm; or very-very low value in resistance mode.

If now appeared LDO_RTC, but no other above mentioned power rails, then change U7800.

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message:
o.k i sew the problem:
NC_PP3v3G3W_PGOOD and NC_P3V3G3W_EN dots under U7800 was not connected, but i dont see where to jump from/where they goes...

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message: this 2 dots look like unconnected so im confused

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing

Did you change U7800?

Forget the unconnected points...

threads.title: 820-00850 dead 20v amp pulsing
threads.message:
Are you sure R7900 is good now (0 ohm)?
Check diode mode to ground at all small coils surrounding U7800.
Just in case, check all big coils too.
